item.title: Transportation, Housing and Urban Development, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2023

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Appropriations.

item.title: Adopting changes to the standing rules, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1232, H. Res. 1230 is considered passed House. (consideration: CR H6711-6718; text: CR H6719)

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 219 - 200 (Roll no. 366). (text: CR H6711)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 219 - 200 (Roll no. 366).
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 219 - 199 (Roll no. 365).
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1232.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H6711-6718)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 87.

Provides for one of hour of general debate on each bill as well as one motion to recommit. Amendments are made in order. Resolution also provides for en bloc suspension authority. H. Res. 1230 is considered adopted.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 117-420, by Ms. Scanlon.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 117-420, by Ms. Scanlon.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 8294) making appropriations for the Departments of Transportation, and Housing and Urban Development, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2023, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 8373) to protect a person's ability to access contraceptives and to engage in contraception, and to protect a health care provider's ability to provide contraceptives, contraception, and information related to contraception; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 8404) to repeal the Defense of Marriage Act and ensure respect for State regulation of marriage, and for other purposes.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 8294) making appropriations for the Departments of Transportation, and Housing and Urban Development, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2023, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 8373) to protect a person's ability to access contraceptives and to engage in contraception, and to protect a health care provider's ability to provide contraceptives, contraception, and information related to contraception; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 8404) to repeal the Defense of Marriage Act and ensure respect for State regulation of marriage, and for other purposes; and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
